sentences: Kõik oma kutid koos. Ilmar on maru, täitsa kutt.
Istuge. Tehke nii, nagu poleks meid olemaski. Klapib, kutid?
context: "Kutid" is the plural form of "kutt" in Estonian, which refers to boys or young men. It's an informal term similar to calling guys "boys," "lads," or "buddies" in English. The word carries a casual, friendly tone when used among peers.
